Problem:
Consider a nonlinear system controlled by the complex function \\( z(t) = r(t)e^{i\\theta(t)} \\), where \\( r(t) \\) is the amplitude and \\( \\theta(t) \\) is the phase. A transformation defined by \\( f(z) = ze^{\\alpha t} \\) with a complex constant \\( \\alpha \\) is considered over time t.

Can we conclusively determine \\( z_0 \\) at t = 0 by observing \\( z(t) \\) at time T if we are uncertain whether the transformation \\( f(z) \\) was applied?
Explanation: Without the certainty of whether \\( f(z) \\) was applied, the differences in the potential amplitude and phase due to the transformation by \\( e^{\\alpha t} \\) make it impossible to accurately trace back to the exact original state \\( z_0 \\).
